newsitem.title: USA: Assets of U.S. money market funds rose in week.
newsitem.headline: Assets of U.S. money market funds rose in week.

text.p: Total money market mutual fund assets in the week ended April 9 rose to $984.55 billion from a revised $975.23 billion the prior week, an industry trade group said Thursday.
The Investment Company Institute said assets of the nation's 665 retail money market mutual funds rose $5.60 billion to $659.63 billion in the week.

Of the retail funds, assets of the 402 taxable money market funds rose $4.27 billion to $538.32 billion, while assets of the 263 tax-exempt funds rose $1.32 billion to $121.31 billion, the group said.

The ICI said assets of the 323 institutional money market funds rose $3.72 billion to $324.92 billion. Of these, assets of the 260 taxable money market funds increased $2.91 billion to $290.63 billion, while assets of the 63 tax-exempt funds grew $813.5 million to $34.29 billion, it said.
The ICI revised last week's money market mutual fund assets to $975.23 billion from $975.36 billion.
